item.title: Colorado Coal Plant Owners Challenge Trump Administrationâ€™s Mandate to Keep Plants Open
item.description: The Trump administration's initiative to sustain the declining coal industry has encountered resistance from within the industry itself. Two Colorado coal plant owners, Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association and Platte River Power Authority, have filed a petition with the Energy Department, arguing that the government's mandate to keep the Craig Station unit operational past its scheduled closure violates their constitutional rights under the Fifth Amendment. The unit was originally set to retire at the end of 2025 due to air pollution regulations, but a mechanical failure and a December order from the administration extended its operation. The Energy Department has defended the move, citing an 'energy emergency' and the need for reliable baseload power. However, utility companies and energy experts point out that keeping aging coal plants operational incurs high costs, which could ultimately affect consumers, and question whether such measures genuinely improve grid reliabi

item.title: French authorities investigate X/Twitter over content moderation, algorithms, and alleged legal violations
item.description:
The article reports that French authorities, with the involvement of Europol and the French Gendarmerie, allegedly searched the Paris offices of X (formerly Twitter) as part of an investigation that began the previous year. According to the text, the inquiry focuses on the platformâ€™s algorithms and their alleged disruption of automated data-processing systems, as well as the impact of recent platform changes, including the integration of the AI tool Grok.
The piece claims that two complaints triggered the investigation, one of them filed by French MP Ã‰ric Bothorel, who reportedly raised concerns about algorithmic manipulation. It further states that the Paris prosecutorâ€™s office has summoned Elon Musk, owner of X, and Linda Yaccarino, who was CEO when the investigation began, to testify on April 20. The article alleges that they would be required to comply with specific guidelines regarding acceptable and unacceptable content if they appear, and that employees of the company have also

item.title: Jon Stewart addresses brief mention of his name in newly released Epstein documents
item.description:
Jon Stewart addressed viewers of The Daily Show after learning that his name appeared in a newly released set of documents connected to the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. During his opening monologue, Stewart explained that he reviewed the files, like many public figures and members of the public, to see whether he was mentioned. He framed the situation with humor while also providing context about how and why his name appeared.
According to Stewart, the reference comes from a 2015 email sent by Epstein to producer Barry Josephson. In the email, Epstein suggested an idea for a hypothetical stand-up project involving filmmaker Woody Allen, proposing that it could be distributed through platforms such as Apple TV or Amazon. Josephson replied by outlining a possible format for the project, describing it as a biographical event that could be hosted or narrated by â€œsomebody like Jon Stewart,â€ or alternatively voiced over by Allen himself.
Stewart joked about the wording of the email on a

item.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi Assassinated by Gunmen in Zintan, Libya
item.description: On February 3, 2026, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, the second son of former Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi and once seen as his potential successor, was assassinated in western Libya. According to reports, four armed assailants disabled security cameras before entering his property in the Hammadah area south of Zintan and shooting him in the garden, then fleeing the scene. His cousin Hamid Gaddafi described him as 'martyred' on Libya Al Ahrar TV, while former Gaddafi spokesman Moussa Ibrahim condemned the killing as treacherous, noting a recent conversation where Saif expressed hopes for a united and sovereign Libya. Libya's Attorney General opened an investigation, with forensic confirmation of death by gunshot wounds, though perpetrators remain unidentified. The 444 Brigade, linked to Tripoli's government, denied involvement. Saif al-Islam, born in 1972, studied architecture and earned a PhD in Europe. He supported his father's regime during the 2011 NATO-backed uprising, faced an ICC arrest

item.title: The U.S. War Plan Red and Its Historical Context in U.S.â€“Canada Relations
item.description:
The article examines War Plan Red, a real military contingency plan developed by the United States between the late 1920s and mid-1930s, which outlined a hypothetical invasion of Canada in the event of a war with the British Empire. Designed in 1927, approved in 1930, and revised in 1935, the plan remained classified until 1974 and reflected interwar strategic thinking rather than an imminent intention to attack Canada. The plan assumed that the United States would quickly neutralize British forces and occupy key Canadian cities, including Halifax, Montreal, Toronto, and Ottawa, to prevent Britain from using Canada as a staging ground.
According to the article, the plan included detailed operational elements such as seizing ports, disrupting infrastructure, and rapidly occupying population centers. Considerable resources were devoted to preparedness, including military exercises near the Canadian border and the construction of airfields disguised as civilian airports. After public dis

item.title: France Replaces US Videoconferencing Tools in Push for European Digital Sovereignty
item.description:
France has decided to phase out the use of U.S.-based videoconferencing platforms such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams within parts of its public administration, marking a significant step in Europeâ€™s broader push for digital sovereignty. The move reflects growing concern among European governments about reliance on American technology firms for critical digital infrastructure, particularly in areas involving sensitive government communications and data protection.
French authorities are encouraging the adoption of European-developed alternatives that comply more closely with EU data protection rules, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Officials argue that even when U.S. companies store data on European servers, they may still be subject to American laws that allow U.S. authorities to access data, raising sovereignty and security concerns. By shifting to homegrown or Europe-based services, France aims to reduce strategic dependencies and strengthen control over publi

item.title: Comprehensive Guide to Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Program in 2026
item.description: Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards is a flexible loyalty program where points never expire and can be earned through paid flights (at 2x to 14x per dollar based on fare type like Basic, Choice, Choice Preferred, or Choice Extra), credit card spending, partner activities, and bonuses. Key features include highly flexible award flights with dynamic pricing tied to cash fares and demand, allowing cancellations or changes up to 10 minutes before departure with no fees and potential point refunds if fares drop. Elite status offers two tiers: A-List (20 flights or 35,000 tier points) provides priority boarding, 25% bonus points, free seat selection benefits, and one free checked bag; A-List Preferred (40 flights or 70,000 tier points) adds Group 1/2 boarding, 100% bonus, free Wi-Fi, premium drinks, and two free checked bags. Major 2025-2026 changes include no free checked bags for most passengers (except elites, credit card holders, or Choice Extra fares), expiring flight credits (12 or 6 mont

item.title: Loganair Offers 50% Discount on Award Flights for Avios Members
item.description: Loganair, the British airline that recently joined the Avios loyalty program, has launched a limited-time promotion offering 50% off award flights. Normally, a one-way Loganair award ticket costs 6,500 Avios, but during this sale, flights can be booked for only 3,250 Avios. To take advantage of this offer, bookings must be made by February 10, 2026, for travel starting March 7, 2026. Certain routes, including inter-Orkney flights, as well as interline and codeshare flights, are excluded from the promotion. This sale can provide significant value for travelers, especially on routes where cash fares are relatively high. For example, a flight from Aberdeen to Kirkwall in March can cost between Â£106 and Â£198 ($145-$271), meaning that redeeming only 3,250 Avios can offer 4.46 to 8.34 cents per point in value. Although Loganair is not a direct partner of any transferable points currency, members can transfer points from programs like British Airways Avios to book these discounted flights. Ov

item.title: Architecture That Responds to Light, Air, and Human Experience
item.description:
The article explores the concept of â€œbreathingâ€ as a contemporary architectural design philosophy that emphasizes responsiveness to light, air, movement, and the surrounding environment. Rather than treating buildings as sealed, static objects, breathing spaces are designed as dynamic frameworks that interact continuously with nature and human presence. From the moment one enters such a space, subtle elementsâ€”shifting daylight, gentle airflow, softened boundaries between indoors and outdoorsâ€”create a sense of calm and vitality.
Central to this approach is the rejection of over-containment. Designers prioritize orientation, openness, and the strategic use of natural light as a core material. Daylight is allowed to define rhythm and mood throughout the day, while shadows, reflections, and transparency are embraced instead of tightly controlled. Openings such as large glazed doors, sliding panels, and folding systems become active architectural elements, enabling cross-ventilation, visua

item.title: Diplomatic Talks Temporarily Delay U.S. Military Action Against Iran
item.description: Diplomatic efforts between the United States and Iran have led to a temporary postponement of any potential U.S. military strike on Iran. Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and U.S. Special Presidential Envoy Steve Witkoff are scheduled to discuss a possible nuclear agreement in Istanbul, with communications currently ongoing via text messages. Jared Kushner, along with senior officials from Turkey, Qatar, and Egypt, is also participating in the negotiations. Recently, U.S. President Trump announced the deployment of significant military forces to the region while expressing hope that Iran would agree to limit its nuclear program. Despite increased military presence, the threat of an immediate attack has decreased, as noted by the Wall Street Journal, which emphasizes protecting U.S. forces and regional allies. The key U.S. demands for any potential agreement include limiting uranium enrichment and restricting Iran's ballistic missile program, while Iran maintains its nuclear prog

item.title: Documents Reveal Social and Financial Ties Between Noam Chomsky and Jeffrey Epstein
item.description:
Recent disclosures from the US Justice Department have revealed extensive communications between Noam Chomsky and the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, providing further detail about their long-standing social and financial interactions. The newly released documents, part of the so-called Epstein files, suggest that Chomsky's relationship with Epstein extended beyond financial matters and included social invitations, vacation plans, and personal correspondence. Some emails show Chomsky and his wife Valeria engaging in friendly exchanges with Epstein and discussing meetings with prominent figures such as Steve Bannon and possibly Woody Allen.
Chomsky also provided advice to Epstein in 2019 regarding public criticism following court rulings about Epstein's past sex offenses. The communications highlight Chomsky's involvement in financial matters, such as discussions over payments and support for a linguistics challenge, where Epstein provided assistance. While there is no ev

item.title: Principles of Biophilic and Secure Design for Emotional Wellbeing in Spaces
item.description:
This article from Moss and Fog explores how intentional design in homes, workplaces, community areas, and outdoor spaces can foster feelings of protection and grounding, which are essential for emotional wellbeing, stress reduction, and mental clarity. Feeling protected goes beyond physical safety to include emotional reassurance through stable, predictable environments that allow the nervous system to relax, improving focus and decision-making. Key qualities include clear organization, visual balance, supportive boundaries, and comforting sensory elements like lighting, sound, and texture.
Grounding connects people to the present and their surroundings via natural materials (wood, stone, fabrics), nature-inspired colors, natural light, and outdoor views, reducing anxiety and enhancing belonging. Boundaries play a crucial role by defining spaces positively, signaling care and structureâ€”especially outdoors, where professional fencing can blend security with aesthetics without feeling o

item.title: NASA Delays Artemis II Launch to March 2026 After Hydrogen Leaks in Wet Dress Rehearsal Test
item.description: NASA's Artemis II mission, the first crewed flight of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and Orion spacecraft aimed at sending four astronauts on a lunar flyby, has been delayed to at least March 2026 following issues during a critical Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) test conducted on February 2, 2026. The test, which simulates fueling and countdown procedures up to T-20 seconds, involved loading approximately 987 tons of cryogenic propellants into the SLS core stage (144 tons of liquid hydrogen and 840 tons of liquid oxygen) and additional propellant into the ICPS upper stage. Although the tanks were successfully filled for the first time in this campaignâ€”a significant improvement over Artemis Iâ€”the test was halted multiple times due to persistent hydrogen leaks at the tail service mast umbilicals (TSMU), the same quick-disconnect interfaces at the base of the core stage that caused repeated delays in 2022. Leaks were detected when the hydrogen tank reached 55%, and despite efforts to war

item.title: Podcast Discusses Upcoming Transition of American Airlines Barclays Cards to Citi in April 2026
item.description: This Frequent Miler podcast episode, released on February 3, 2026, focuses on the major shift in American Airlines AAdvantage credit card issuance. Starting April 24, 2026, Barclays will no longer issue these cards, as Citi becomes the exclusive partner following an agreement to acquire Barclays' portfolio. Existing Barclays AAdvantage cardholders will automatically transition to comparable Citi-issued versions, receiving new cards with updated account numbers mailed within 6-8 weeks from April 27, 2026. Cardholders can continue using their current Barclays cards until the new ones are activated, with credit limits and anniversary dates preserved. The episode highlights key differences, such as companion certificate structures between Barclays and Citi offerings, and addresses concerns for specific tiers like $99 annual fee cards and the potential shift from Aviator Silver to the higher-fee Citi AAdvantage Globe card. It explores whether cardholders should cancel Barclays cards before

item.title: IHG Offers 15% Discount on Award Stays at Newly Opened Hotels
item.description: IHG is continuing its promotion that offers a 15% discount on award stays at newly opened hotels. This program has been active for several years and applies to different properties each month, covering stays up to three months in advance. The list of eligible hotels is updated monthly, and the latest round of discounted award stays is available through April 30, 2026. Bookings must be made by specific dates depending on the property: February 28, March 31, or April 30, 2026. While many of the new IHG properties, particularly in the United States, are budget-friendly brands such as Candlewood Suites and Garner, there are several interesting options worldwide. Notable new properties include voco hotels in Aruba, China, Italy, Thailand, and Dubai; Iberostar all-inclusive resorts in Mallorca; a Kimpton hotel in Kuala Lumpur; and a Crowne Plaza Resort in Petra, Jordan. Travelers interested in maximizing the value of IHG points may find these discounts worthwhile. Frequent Miler recommends c

item.title: Capital One Shopping introduces new gift card redemption options including Marriott Bonvoy
item.description: Capital One Shopping has recently expanded its gift card redemption options, adding several popular merchants including Marriott Bonvoy, eBay, Walmart, Lowe's, Uber/Uber Eats, Petco, Holland America Cruise Lines, Groupon, Zappos, and more. These rewards are only available as gift cards, and the available options vary by user. The portal frequently updates its gift card offerings, with popular options appearing and disappearing without warning. The addition of Marriott Bonvoy is particularly beneficial for travelers, as these gift cards can be used globally at Marriott and Starwood properties, although users are advised to bring the cards to the front desk early to ensure smooth redemption. Other users have appreciated the return of gift cards for Petco, REI, and other general retailers. Fulfillment of gift cards may take between a few minutes to up to 72 hours. Frequent Miler recommends redeeming rewards promptly when desirable options appear, as the portalâ€™s dynamic offerings may not

item.title: Frequent Miler Announces Next Ask Us Anything Live Session on February 4, 2026 at 9pm ET
item.description: Frequent Miler, a popular blog focused on maximizing credit card rewards, points, and miles for travel, has announced its monthly 'Ask Us Anything' live event. Hosted by the Frequent Miler team, including Stephen Pepper, the session is scheduled for Wednesday, February 4, 2026, at 9:00 PM Eastern Time on their YouTube channel. During these interactive streams, the team answers viewer-submitted questions about credit cards, transferable points programs like Amex Membership Rewards, Chase Ultimate Rewards, and Citi ThankYou, award bookings, airline and hotel loyalty strategies, manufactured spending, and other ways to earn and redeem miles efficiently. The post encourages viewers to subscribe to the Frequent Miler YouTube channel and enable notifications to stay updated on the live episodes. It also links to the most recent session recording and an archive of past episodes for those wanting to catch up. The blog provides extensive resources on topics such as best credit card offers, tran

item.title: Southwest Launches Flash Promotion: Earn Short-Term Companion Pass with One Round-Trip or Two One-Way Flights
item.description: Southwest Airlines has relaunched a limited-time promotion for Rapid Rewards members to earn a promotional Companion Pass with minimal effort. Members must register and then book one qualifying round-trip or two one-way flights between February 2 and February 5, 2026, for travel completed by March 31, 2026. Qualifying bookings include new reservations via Southwest's channels, with Rapid Rewards number added, covering revenue fares and award redemptions (including Cash + Points). Exclusions apply to charters, groups, and certain bookings. Upon flying the qualifying itinerary, participants receive a Companion Pass valid from August 10 to October 7, 2026, allowing a designated companion to fly free (paying only taxes/fees) on unlimited flights taken by the passholder during that window. This perk, normally requiring far more activity (100 flights or 135,000 qualifying points annually), offers great value for pairs traveling domestically. item.title: Alaska, American, and United Shopping Portals Offer 500 Bonus Miles/Points for Qualifying Spend in February 2026
item.description: As of February 3, 2026, Frequent Miler reports that three major airline shopping portals are running limited-time 'Winter Bonus' promotions, providing an additional 500 bonus miles or points for meeting modest spending thresholds. Alaska Airlines' Atmos Rewards Shopping portal offers 500 bonus points for cumulative qualifying purchases of $150 or more, with the promotion active from February 2, 2026, through February 11, 2026, at 11:59:59 pm ET. American Airlines' AAdvantage eShopping provides 500 bonus AAdvantage miles for spending $200, expiring February 9, 2025 (likely intended as 2026). United Airlines' MileagePlus Shopping matches with 500 bonus MileagePlus miles for $150 spend, also ending February 9, 2025 (likely 2026). These bonuses are added to standard earnings from shopping through the portals, which include both online purchases and in-store offers via card-linked programs where spend counts toward the thresholds. Key exclusions for qualifying purchases include returns, can

item.title: Franceâ€™s Colonial Legacy and the Contradictions of Republican Universalism
item.description:
In this long-form opinion essay, Rafael Poch de Feliu examines the deep historical roots of European, and particularly French, complicity with contemporary colonial violence, using the case of Gaza as a moral and political point of departure. The article argues that Franceâ€™s Third Republic (1870â€“1940), often celebrated as a milestone of democratic freedoms and civic rights, simultaneously consolidated a brutal and explicitly racist colonial system. While republican liberties, secular education, and parliamentary life flourished within metropolitan France, the empire was governed through coercion, legal discrimination, and permanent states of exception.
Poch details how colonial domination was codified through mechanisms such as the Code de lâ€™IndigÃ©nat, which denied basic rights to colonized populations and institutionalized forced labor, collective punishment, and racial hierarchy. Prominent republican figures like Jules Ferry embodied this contradiction, defending universal education

item.title: EU Military Assistance Plans Risk Escalation as the War in Ukraine Deepens
item.description:
The article argues that the European Union is moving toward a dangerously escalatory path in its approach to the war in Ukraine. It focuses on proposals by Manfred Weber, leader of the European Peopleâ€™s Party, to strengthen and operationalize Article 42.7 of the EU Treaty, the mutual assistance clause that obliges member states to provide aid, including military support, in the event of an attack. According to the author, making this clause more concrete could significantly lower the threshold for EU involvement in armed conflict, especially if Ukraine joins the EU as planned in early 2027 while hostilities with Russia continue.
The text warns that such a move could rapidly draw the EU into war, not only through Ukraine but also through potential flashpoints in the Baltic states or other sensitive regions. It suggests that this may be an intentional strategy to use the assistance clause as a de facto European security guarantee for Eastern Europe, with some voices even proposing Ukrai
